comments:
While running some of the import tests (specifically, the ImportExistingTest class) I get the an illegal arg exception which appears to be a result of code in the ProgressInfoItem.refresh() method:
taskEntries = taskEntries.subList(0, infos.length-1);

In my case, infos is an empty array so subList is called with (0, -1) which throws an IllegalArgumentException.

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: fromIndex(0) > toIndex(-1)
	at java.util.SubList.<init>(AbstractList.java:707)
	at java.util.RandomAccessSubList.<init>(AbstractList.java:861)
	at java.util.AbstractList.subList(AbstractList.java:570)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressInfoItem.refresh(ProgressInfoItem.java:535)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressInfoItem.createChildren(ProgressInfoItem.java:269)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressInfoItem.<init>(ProgressInfoItem.java:173)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.DetailedProgressViewer.createNewItem(DetailedProgressViewer.java:129)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.DetailedProgressViewer.refreshAll(DetailedProgressViewer.java:407)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.DetailedProgressViewer.internalRefresh(DetailedProgressViewer.java:307)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.internalRefresh(StructuredViewer.java:1182)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer$8.run(StructuredViewer.java:1386)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1294)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1384)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1341)
*** Bug 131790 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This is quite a pain. Could we get new I-build since many might want to use the latest I-build for eclipseCon?

Are you getting this a lot in regular development Dani? Karice only saw it in the test suites.

If so can you give me steps so that I can verify.
I'll try to reproduce. I had it after starting Eclipse, typing in the editor and then doing Edit > Revert while other jobs were still running. There was also a bad dialog with no text except 'error'.
See also bug 131888 and bug 131790 which indicates that this happens quite often.
*** Bug 131888 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Tod, I just had about 100 error messages fired at me during a build. The same things happened yesterday. It happened when Eclipse was rebuilding after a crash. Anything that used the progress view seemed to result in the error. If you already have it fixed, I think it is worthwhile to spin a new build.
I think we will - I am just nervous that I have never replicated it so I would appreciate it if you could load from HEAD and self host and see if you can make it happen again.
I have released this fix for the noon build
